title: Electric cars: Five big questions answered
description: The electric car revolution is speeding up but what do buyers really want to know?

title: Malmo stabbing prompts soul-searching in Sweden
description: A string of violent attacks in Sweden's schools has a country not used to such tragedies looking for answers.

title: England in West Indies: Joe Root's side facing defeat in Grenada after disastrous day
description: England set for another humiliating defeat after enduring a disastrous third day of the decisive third Test against West Indies in Grenada.

title: War in Ukraine: Musicians perform emotional concert in Kharkiv metro station
description: Musicians performed the concert at a metro station in Kharkiv, being used as a makeshift shelter.

title: Ukraine defence: Red lights and painted arrows fuel fear of Russian agents
description: Fear of Russian saboteurs operating in Ukraine has soared, but is it based on intelligence and arrests?

title: P&O Ferries ship detained over crew training concerns
description: It comes after 800 of the firm's staff were sacked and replaced with workers on cheaper wages.

title: BBC Breakfast forced off air early by fire alarm
description: Roger Johnson and Rachel Burden were interviewing The Apprentice winner Harpreet Kaur at the time.

title: Ukraine war: Oligarch Eugene Shvidler's jets held indefinitely
description: The two planes belong to Eugene Shvidler, an associate of Roman Abramovich, the government says.

title: Russian general Yakov Rezantsev killed in Ukraine
description: Western officials believe low morale among Russian troops is forcing generals to the battlefield.

title: Antytila: Ukrainian band backed by Ed Sheeran refused fundraiser slot
description: Organisers say the band cannot play as their charities must avoid association with the military.

title: Afghanistan: Protesters urge Taliban to reopen girls' schools
description: One demonstrator said: "I want our generation to be free and to flourish, not just to shed tears at home."

title: Black man 'not dressed for climate' searched by Met police
description: Officers are heard in footage saying it was "odd" the man was wearing a coat in warm weather.

title: F1 drivers met for four hours before agreeing to race in Saudi after missile attack
description: The Saudi Arabian Grand Prix will go ahead after Formula 1 drivers agreed to race despite security concerns after a nearby missile attack.

title: Man and woman die in Nottingham house fire
description: An inquiry is under way after the house was "severely damaged" and nearby properties evacuated.

title: Taylor Hawkins: Foo Fighters' drummer dies aged 50
description: The band said they were "devastated" by the loss of Hawkins, who has drummed with them since 1997.

title: Michael Bisping: Former UFC champion 'lost identity' after losing sight in one eye
description: Former UFC middleweight champion Michael Bisping tells BBC Sport's Paul Battison he lost his "identity" after losing his vision in one eye.

title: Michael Bisping: Former UFC star looks back on remarkable career in new documentary
description: Former UFC middleweight champion Michael Bisping tells BBC Sport how he rebuilt his career after going blind in one eye.

title: 'Fraudsters stole everything, even my house'
description: Pensioner Graeme Stagg says that fraudsters destroyed his life by taking everything.

title: Women's World Cup: Suzie Bates gets standing ovation as she hits 126 for New Zealand
description: Opener Suzie Bates hits an imperious 126 in New Zealand's 71-run win against Pakistan in Christchurch, with bowler Hannah Rowe also impressing with figures of 5-55.

title: The papers: 'Russian retreat' and calls for P&O chief to quit
description: Moscow's move to refocus its war in Ukraine and the fallout from P&O's sacking of 800 staff lead the papers.

title: Belfast: The real people and streets behind Branagh’s film
description: The Oscar-nominated film draws on the director’s childhood in the Tiger's Bay area of north Belfast.

title: Prince William tells Caribbean tour that relationships evolve
description: There have been calls for Jamaica to become a republic, months after Barbados chose a new head of state.

title: Netflix's Diana the Musical named worst film by Razzie Awards
description: The Netflix musical "wins" five Razzie Awards, which name and shame the year's worst films.

title: HMRC must do more to recover taxes unpaid due to pandemic, say MPs
description: The total tax debt in the UK now stands at £39bn, more than double what it was before the pandemic.

title: Solar farms: Can expansion overcome Tory MPs' concerns?
description: Ministers hope solar farms can vary the UK's energy mix - but they face increasing local opposition.

title: Week in pictures: 19 - 25 March 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Ukraine war: Ros Atkins on... Putin’s false ‘Nazi’ claims
description: Russia is spreading untruths about Nazis in Ukraine - one of Putin's justifications for his invasion.

title: Hazara: The female karate champions 'breaking out of the cage'
description: Women from the Hazara community say the martial art helps them break out of the restrictions their community faces.

title: Anime: How Japanese animation has taken the West by storm
description: Animated film Jujutsu Kaisen 0 is a surprise box office hit, as anime enjoys a new global popularity.

title: 1,000-year-old oaks used to create 'super forest'
description: Could an experimental forest hold the answers to meeting the UK's big tree planting ambitions?

title: Civilian deaths: Aerial video shows escaping father killed in Ukraine
description: Video captured by a Ukrainian aerial reconnaissance group appears to show Russian forces shooting at civilians.

title: Ethiopia's civil war: The women who paid the price
description: The BBC speaks to victims of sexual violence as rights groups say rape was used as a weapon of war.

title: Celebration as the Oscars ceremony returns to Hollywood
description: After a year away due to Covid, this year's ceremony is back to its glitzy best in tinseltown.

title: Will Ukraine invasion push Japan to go nuclear?
description: Ex-PM Shinzo Abe shocked Japan by saying it should think about nuclear weapons - but he's not alone.
